page.title: 20Mitcham Windmill
page.content: John Barker was given land on Mitcham Common to build a flour mill in{1806 In the{1860's}lightning struck and two of the sails were knocked off. It was not used again. In{1905}the main body of the mill was demolished. {THE MILL {IN 1985} We visited the remains of the mill. It is in Windmill Rd. near Windmill House behind an old biscuit factory but people don't work there any more.All the machinery and the sails are missing. Only the wall at the bottom and three wooden legs on top of it are left. Grass is growing out of the wall. It was called a post mill because it had a big post in the middle going up to the top. Part of the post is still there.This was used to turn the sails into the wind. We got out our sketch pads to draw the ruins and imagined when the wind blew the sails round.
